org.jscsi.target.scsi.modeSense

Class ModeParameterHeader

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jscsi.target.scsi.modeSense.ModeParameterHeader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ISerializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ModeParameterHeader10, ModeParameterHeader6

    public abstract class ModeParameterHeader
extends Object
implements ISerializable
    Instances ModeParameterHeader are part of ModeParameterList objects and specify the layout and length of the following non-header fields.
    Author:
    Andreas Ergenzinger

    • Field Summary

    • Field Detail

      • modeDataLength

        protected final int modeDataLength
        When using the MODE SENSE command, the MODE DATA LENGTH field indicates the length in bytes of the following data that is available to be transferred. The mode data length does not include the number of bytes in the MODE DATA LENGTH field.

        When using the MODE SELECT command, this field is reserved.

        Logical units that support more than 256 bytes of block descriptors and mode pages may need to implement ten-byte mode commands. The mode data length field in the six-byte CDB header limits the returned data to 256 bytes.

      • mediumType

        protected final byte mediumType
        The contents of the MEDIUM TYPE field are unique for each device type. For direct-access block devices, the value must be 0x00.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • deviceSpecificParameter

        protected final byte deviceSpecificParameter
        The DEVICE-SPECIFIC PARAMETER field is unique for each device type. For direct-access block devices the byte looks like this:

        +---+---+---+---+---+---+---+---+---+
        |bit| 7 | 6 | 5 | 4 | 3 | 2 | 1 | 0 |
        +---+---+---+---+---+---+---+---+---+
        |___|WP_|RESERV-|DPO|___RESERVED____|
        |___|___|__ED___|FUA|_______________|
        +---+---+---+---+---+---+---+---+---+

        When used with the MODE SELECT command, the write protect (WP) bit is not defined. When used with the MODE SENSE command, a WP bit set to one indicates that the medium is write-protected. A WP bit set to zero indicates that the medium is not write-protected. When the software write protect (SWP) bit in the Control mode page (see SPC-4) is set to one, the WP bit shall be set to one.

        When the SWP bit in the Control mode page is set to zero, the WP bit shall be set to one if the medium is write-protected (e.g., due to mechanisms outside the scope of this standard) or zero if the medium is not write-protected.

        When used with the MODE SELECT command, the DPOFUA bit is reserved. When used with the MODE SENSE command, a DPOFUA bit set to zero indicates that the device server does not support the DPO and FUA bits. When used with the MODE SENSE command, a DPOFUA bit set to one indicates that the device server supports the DPO and FUA bits.

        So, the simulated logical unit of the jSCSI Target must always use a value of 0x00.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • blockDescriptorLength

        protected final int blockDescriptorLength
        The BLOCK DESCRIPTOR LENGTH field contains the length in bytes of all the block descriptors. It is equal to the number of block descriptors times eight if the LONGLBA bit is set to zero or times sixteen if the LONGLBA bit is set to one, and does not include mode pages or vendor specific parameters (e.g., page code set to zero), if any, that may follow the last block descriptor. A block descriptor length of zero indicates that no block descriptors are included in the mode parameter list. This condition shall not be considered an error.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ModeParameterHeader

        public ModeParameterHeader(int modeDataLength,
                   int blockDescriptorLength)
        The abstract constructor.
        Parameters:
        modeDataLength - the length in bytes of all MODE DATA list elements
        blockDescriptorLength - the length in bytes of all BLOCK DESCRIPTOR list elements
